content.title: Lymphocele
content.description: Collection of lymphatic fluid after groin dissection

key_concepts.details: 5-10% after groin dissection; often clinically insignificant
Groin swelling, serous drainage, compression of adjacent structures
Careful lymphatic ligation during exposure; limited circumferential dissection
Observation if small; aspiration; sclerotherapy; surgical marsupialization for recurrent

content.clinical_significance: Usually self-limited but can predispose to infection
